DOC.brief_summary: This study will determine if the protective function of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) is impaired in obese patients and will help to enhance cardiovascular risk prediction. Carotid intima-media thickness (cIMT) will be captured as a means of assessing early vascular changes associated with low HDL levels in obesity. A novel measurement for clinical correlation has also been introduced called carotid extra-medial thickness (cEMT) which will be compared to cIMT in this obese population.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of High-Density Lipoprotein in Obesity Study
DOC.criteria: Group 1: Age 2080 English speaking BMI 2025 kg/m2 Group 2: Age 2080 English speaking BMI > 30 kg/m2 TG > 150 and HDL > 50 (females) >40 (Males) Group 3: Age 2080 English speaking BMI > 30 kg/m2 TG > 150 and HDL < 50 (females) < 40 (males) Selfreported history of: Diabetes mellitus Any previous lipid therapy within the last three months Macrovascular events including TIA, stroke, myocardial infarction, heart failure, claudication, or known peripheral vascular disease Current pregnancy
